intro: Lantana hypoleuca f. albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflowered lantana, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically produces white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of water bodies.
